section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Bunker Oil Pollution (Liability and Compensation) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for an insurance certificate to be issued by the Director, the fee prescribed in regulations made under section 33; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized under section 25(1);

def.name: BunkerOil
def.leadIn: bunker oil (燃油), in relation to a ship, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any hydrocarbon mineral oil used or intended to be used for the operation or propulsion of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any residue of the hydrocarbon mineral oil referred to in paragraph (a);

subsection.def: Bunker Oil Convention (《燃油公約》) means the International Convention on Civil Liability for Bunker Oil Pollution Damage, 2001 done at London on 23 March 2001;
Bunker Oil Convention place (《燃油公約》適用地) means a place in respect of which the Bunker Oil Convention is in force;
competent authority (主管當局) means a competent authority as defined in section 13(5);
Court (法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
Director (處長) means the Director of Marine;
enforcement officer (執法人員) means the Director or any officer appointed under section 26;

gross tonnage (總噸位), in relation to a ship, means the gross tonnage of the ship determined in accordance with regulation 6 of the Merchant Shipping (Registration) (Tonnage) Regulations (Cap. 415 sub. leg. C);

def.name: Incident
def.leadIn: incident (事故) means any occurrence, or any series of occurrences having the same origin, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes any discharge or escape of bunker oil from a ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes any relevant threat of contamination to occur;

subsection.def: insurance certificate (保險證書) means a certificate required under section 13(1);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the territorial sea of a place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any exclusive economic zone of a place established in accordance with international law or, in the absence of such an exclusive economic zone, an area beyond and adjacent to the territorial sea of the place determined in accordance with international law and extending not more than 200 nautical miles from the baseline from which the breadth of its territorial sea is measured;

def.name: PollutionDamage
def.leadIn: pollution damage (污染損害), in relation to an incident, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the incident causes any discharge or escape of bunker oil from a ship—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any damage caused outside the ship by contamination resulting from the discharge or escape;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the cost of any preventive measures taken after the discharge or escape; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any damage caused outside the ship by any preventive measures taken after the discharge or escape; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the incident causes any relevant threat of contamination to occur—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the cost of any preventive measures taken after the incident; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any damage caused outside the ship by any preventive measures taken after the incident;

def.name: PreventiveMeasures
def.leadIn: preventive measures (預防措施), in relation to an incident, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the incident causes any discharge or escape of bunker oil from a ship, any reasonable measures taken by a person to prevent or minimize any damage referred to in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of pollution damage; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: RegisteredOwner
def.leadIn: registered owner (註冊擁有人), in relation to a ship, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the ship is owned by a state and operated by a person registered in that state as the operator of the ship, that person; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: relevant threat of contamination (有關的污染威脅) means a grave and imminent threat of damage caused outside a ship by contamination that might result if there were a discharge or escape of bunker oil from the ship;

def.name: Shipowner
def.leadIn: shipowner (船東), in relation to a ship, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the bareboat charterer of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager of the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registered owner of the ship; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other person who is the owner or the operator of the ship;

subsection.def: specified certificate (指明證書) means a specified certificate as defined in section 13(5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if more than one discharge or escape results from the same occurrence or from a series of occurrences having the same origin—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discharges or escapes together are to be treated as a single discharge or escape; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any measures taken after any of those discharges or escapes are to be treated as having been taken after the single discharge or escape.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if any relevant threat of contamination results from an incident that consists of a series of occurrences having the same origin, any measures taken after any of those occurrences are to be treated as having been taken after the incident.

In this Part, a reference to a discharge or escape of any bunker oil from a ship is a reference to a discharge or escape of any bunker oil from the ship, regardless of whether the discharge or escape occurs in Hong Kong or any other place.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part and Part 2, a reference to the shipowner of a ship is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any pollution damage resulting from a discharge or escape of bunker oil from the ship—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: if the discharge or escape resulted from a series of occurrences having the same origin, the shipowner of the ship at the time of the first of those occurrences; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any pollution damage resulting from a relevant threat of contamination—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the shipowner of the ship at the time of the occurrence resulting in the threat; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the threat occurs as a result of a series of occurrences having the same origin, the shipowner of the ship at the time of the first of those occurrences.

subsection.content: For the purposes of Part 3, if the gross tonnage of a ship is not a whole number, decimals are to be rounded off downwards.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a ship owned or operated by a state includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a ship owned or operated by the government of a state; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a ship owned or operated by the government of a territory within a state (including the HKSAR);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a ship owned by a state includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a ship owned by the government of a state; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a ship owned by the government of a territory within a state (including the HKSAR); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a ship owned by the government mentioned in paragraph (b)(i) or (ii), the reference to a certificate issued by the state in the definition of specified certificate in section 13(5) is a reference to a certificate issued by the government that owns the ship.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), this Ordinance applies to any ship, whether or not within the waters of Hong Kong, including a ship owned or operated by the Government.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any warship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any naval auxiliary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other ship that is owned or operated by a state and for the time being used by it only on government non-commercial service.

subsection.content: This Ordinance does not apply in relation to any pollution damage to which the Liability Convention applies.
Neither the Government, nor any public officer in the officer’s capacity as such, is liable to be prosecuted for an offence against this Ordinance.

subsection.def: In subsection (3), Liability Convention (《法律責任公約》) means the International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage, 1992, as modified by Resolution LEG. 1(82) adopted by the Legal Committee of the International Maritime Organization on 18 October 2000.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application of this Part
section.content: This Part does not apply in relation to any occurrence that took place before the commencement* of this Part or, if there is a series of occurrences having the same origin and the first of those occurrences took place before the commencement, any of those occurrences.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Liability of shipowners of ships for pollution damage

subsection.content: If, as a result of an incident, any pollution damage is caused in Hong Kong, the shipowner of the ship concerned is liable for the damage caused.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a liability arises under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the incident also causes any pollution damage in any other Bunker Oil Convention place,

subsection.continued: the shipowner of the ship concerned is also liable for the damage caused, and a claim against the shipowner’s liability under this subsection may be brought in the Court as if the damage were caused in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The shipowner of a ship is not liable under subsection (1) or (2) for any damage attributable to the impairment of the environment unless the damage is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: loss of profits from the impairment of the environment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cost of any reasonable measures of reinstatement of the environment actually taken or to be taken.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Liability of shipowners of ships—joint and several

subsection.content: If a liability is incurred under section 5 and the ship concerned has more than one shipowner, the shipowners are liable jointly and severally with each other.

If a liability is incurred under section 5 by the shipowner of each of 2 or more ships, and the pollution damage for which each of the shipowners of those ships would, apart from this subsection, be liable cannot reasonably be separated from that for which the other shipowner or shipowners would be liable, the shipowners of all those ships are liable jointly and severally with each other for the whole of the damage.

If a person is liable under section 5 for any pollution damage that is not due to the person’s fault, then despite the fact that the damage is not due to the person’s fault, section 21 of the Law Amendment and Reform (Consolidation) Ordinance (Cap. 23) applies in relation to the damage as if it were due to the person’s fault.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exemptions from liability under section 5
section.leadIn: The shipowner of a ship is not liable under section 5 in respect of any damage resulting from an incident if the shipowner proves that the incident—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resulted from an act of war, hostilities, civil war, insurrection or an exceptional, inevitable and irresistible natural phenomenon;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was due wholly to anything done or omitted to be done by any other person, not being a servant or agent of the shipowner, with intent to cause damage;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: was due wholly to the negligence of the person who suffered the damage; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: was due wholly to the negligence or wrongful act of a government or any other authority in exercising its function of maintaining lights or other navigational aids for the maintenance of which it was responsible.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Limitation of liability of shipowners of ships
section.leadIn: If the shipowner of a ship has incurred or is alleged to have incurred a liability under section 5—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shipowner may bring an action in the Court to limit the shipowner’s liability under Part III of the Merchant Shipping (Limitation of Shipowners Liability) Ordinance (Cap. 434); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liability of the shipowner is, for the purposes of paragraph (a), to be treated as a liability in respect of damage to property mentioned in paragraph 1(a) of Article 2 of the Convention on Limitation of Liability for Maritime Claims, 1976 set out in Schedule 2 to that Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Liability of persons other than shipowners of ships

subsection.leadIn: If an incident occurs, whether or not the shipowner of the ship concerned incurs a liability under section 5, a specified person is not liable for any damage referred to in that section resulting from any act done or omitted to be done by the person, unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: did the act or omitted to do the act with intent to cause the damage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly did the act or omitted to do the act knowing that the damage would probably be caused.

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any servant or agent of the shipowner of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who does not fall within the description in paragraph (a) but is employed or engaged in any capacity on board the ship or to perform any services for the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person who performs salvage operations with the consent of the shipowner of the ship or on the instructions of a public authority who is vested with the power to issue the instructions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any person who takes preventive measures; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any servant or agent of a person mentioned in paragraph (c) or (d).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Rights of third parties against insurers

subsection.leadIn: If it is alleged that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a result of an incident the shipowner of a ship has incurred a liability under section 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: while the incident occurred, there was in force a contract of insurance or other security to which an insurance certificate in respect of the ship relates,

subsection.continued: legal proceedings to enforce a claim in respect of the liability may be brought against the person who provided the insurance or other security (an insurer).

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is brought against an insurer under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the insurer may bring an action in the Court under section 8 to limit the insurer’s liability under Part III of the Merchant Shipping (Limitation of Shipowners Liability) Ordinance (Cap. 434) as if the insurer were the shipowner of the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that the shipowner of the ship may not be or is not entitled to limit the shipowner’s liability under Part III of that Ordinance does not affect the right of the insurer to limit the insurer’s liability under that Part.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings brought against an insurer under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the insurer is entitled to invoke any defence that the shipowner of the ship would have been entitled to invoke in relation to a claim against the shipowner under section 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is a defence, in addition to any defence affecting the liability of the shipowner, for the insurer to prove that the incident was due to the wilful misconduct of the shipowner,

subsection.continued: but the insurer is not entitled to invoke any other defence that the insurer might have been entitled to invoke in legal proceedings brought by the shipowner against the insurer.

subsection.content: In any legal proceedings brought against an insurer under this section, the insurer may require the shipowner of the ship to join in the proceedings as a party.
The Third Parties (Rights against Insurers) Ordinance (Cap. 273) does not apply in relation to any contract of insurance to which an insurance certificate relates.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Whether shipowners of ships would be liable for pollution damage etc. otherwise than under section 5
section.content: If an incident occurs, whether or not the shipowner of a ship is liable under section 5, the shipowner is not liable under any other law of Hong Kong for any pollution damage referred to in that section.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application of this Part

subsection.content: This Part applies to a ship having a gross tonnage of more than 1 000, but does not apply to a local vessel that operates exclusively within the river trade limits.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: local vessel (本地船隻) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548);
river trade limits (內河航限) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Compulsory insurance against liability for pollution damage

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a ship is not allowed to enter or leave the waters of Hong Kong unless there is in force a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: complying with the requirements in paragraphs 2 and 4 of Article 7 of the Bunker Oil Convention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certifying that there is in force in respect of the ship a contract of insurance or other security satisfying the requirements of Article 7 of the Convention.

subsection.content: A certificate required under subsection (1) must be issued by a competent authority.
A ship that is owned by a state may enter or leave the waters of Hong Kong without a certificate required under subsection (1), if there is in force in respect of the ship a specified certificate.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) is contravened, the master and the registered owner of the ship each commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a ship registered in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an authorized person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a ship registered in any other Bunker Oil Convention place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the government of that other place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by the government of that other place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any other ship—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an authorized person;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the government of a Bunker Oil Convention place other than Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by the government of a Bunker Oil Convention place other than Hong Kong;

def.name: SpecifiedCertificate
def.leadIn: specified certificate (指明證書), in relation to a ship owned by a state, means a certificate issued by the state and certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is owned by the state; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liability for pollution damage as defined in Article 1 of the Bunker Oil Convention will be met up to the limit determined under paragraph 1 of Article 7 of the Convention.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Duty of masters of ships to keep insurance certificates or specified certificates on ships

subsection.content: The master of a ship, other than a ship registered in Hong Kong, must ensure that an insurance certificate or a specified certificate (as the case requires) that is in force in respect of the ship is kept at all times on the ship when the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong.

The master of a ship registered in Hong Kong must ensure that an insurance certificate or a specified certificate (as the case requires) that is in force in respect of the ship is kept at all times on the ship, whether or not the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong.

The master of a ship within the waters of Hong Kong must produce for inspection, on request by an enforcement officer in the performance of their functions under this Ordinance, the insurance certificate or the specified certificate referred to in subsection (1).

If a ship registered in Hong Kong is within the waters of any other Bunker Oil Convention place, the master of the ship must produce for inspection, on request by a person duly authorized for that purpose by the government of that other place, the insurance certificate or the specified certificate referred to in subsection (2).
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply in relation to a ship if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is in force in respect of the ship an insurance certificate or a specified certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary-General of the International Maritime Organization has been notified under paragraph 13 of Article 7 of the Bunker Oil Convention of the maintenance of a record in electronic form that attests to the existence of the certificate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the record is accessible to the Director.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Application for insurance certificates etc.

subsection.content: The shipowner of a ship registered in Hong Kong or of any other ship, other than a ship registered in any other Bunker Oil Convention place, may apply to the Director or an authorized person for an insurance certificate for the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in a form specified by the Director; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a contract of insurance or other security relating to the ship; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any document or information that the Director or the authorized person may reasonably require for the purpose of considering the application.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Power of Director or authorized persons to issue insurance certificates etc.

subsection.content: If, on an application made under section 15 and on payment of the application fee, the Director or the authorized person is satisfied that the condition in subsection (2) is fulfilled, the Director or the authorized person may issue an insurance certificate for the ship.

The condition is that there will be in force in respect of the ship, throughout the period for which the insurance certificate is to be issued, a contract of insurance or other security satisfying the requirements in paragraphs 1 and 6 of Article 7 of the Bunker Oil Convention.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or the authorized person may refuse to issue an insurance certificate for a ship if the Director or the authorized person is of the opinion that there is doubt as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person providing the insurance or other security will be able to meet the person’s obligations under the insurance or other security; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the insurance or other security will satisfy the requirements in paragraphs 1 and 6 of Article 7 of the Bunker Oil Convention.

subsection.content: An insurance certificate issued under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition that the Director or the authorized person may impose.
The Director must keep a copy of each certificate issued by the Director or an authorized person under this section and make it available for public inspection.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Cancellation and delivery up of insurance certificates issued by Director or authorized persons

subsection.content: If, at any time while a certificate issued under section 16 is in force in respect of a ship, a person ceases to be the registered owner of the ship, the certificate is to be treated as cancelled once the person ceases to be the registered owner.

If, at any time while a certificate issued under section 16 is in force in respect of a ship, it is established in any legal proceedings that the contract of insurance or other security to which the certificate relates is invalid or may be treated as invalid, the issuing authority may cancel the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: If, at any time after a certificate is issued under section 16 in respect of a ship, any circumstances arise in relation to an insurer or guarantor named in the certificate such that the issuing authority is of the opinion that there is doubt as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person providing the insurance or other security will be able to meet the person’s obligations under the insurance or other security; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the insurance or other security will cover the liability of the shipowner of the ship under this Ordinance in all circumstances,

subsection.continued: the issuing authority may cancel the certificate.

subsection.content: If a certificate issued under section 16 is cancelled under this section, the person to whom the certificate is issued must as soon as reasonably practicable deliver up the certificate to the issuing authority.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, issuing authority (發證當局), in relation to a certificate issued under section 16, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the certificate is issued by the Director, the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the certificate is issued by an authorized person, the authorized person.

subsection.content: This section does not operate so as to affect section 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s17A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3A
section.def: e-cert guidelines (電子證書指引) means the documents listed in the Schedule, as from time to time revised or amended by revisions or amendments to those documents;
issuing authority (發證當局) means—(a)the Director; or(b)an authorized person;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Transport and Logistics.

section.name: s17B
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Part and the Schedule apply to a ship registered in Hong Kong.

section.name: s17C
section.heading: Insurance certificates may be issued electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to an insurance certificate that may be issued by an issuing authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
An insurance certificate may be issued by an issuing authority in electronic form.
An insurance certificate is considered as issued in electronic form only if it is issued in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.
An issuing authority must cause an insurance certificate issued by it in accordance with this section to be kept in the e-cert database.

section.name: s17D
section.heading: Insurance certificates may be cancelled electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to an insurance certificate that may be cancelled by an issuing authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
An insurance certificate may be cancelled by an issuing authority in electronic form.
An insurance certificate is considered as cancelled in electronic form only if the cancellation is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.

If an insurance certificate is cancelled in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up the certificate on its cancellation is regarded as having been met and physical delivery of the certificate is no longer required.
An issuing authority must cause a cancellation made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the insurance certificate.

section.name: s17E
section.heading: Power of Secretary to amend Schedule

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule.

A notice published under subsection (1) may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, savings or transitional provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of the amendments made under that subsection.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Jurisdiction of Hong Kong Courts to Enforce Claims and Enforcement in Hong Kong of Judgements Given by Courts of other Places, etc.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Jurisdiction of Hong Kong courts to enforce claims arising from pollution damage in Hong Kong and in any other Bunker Oil Convention places

subsection.content: For the purposes of Part 2, if as a result of an incident, any pollution damage is caused in Hong Kong, an action may be brought in the Court to enforce a claim arising from the pollution damage.

For the purposes of Part 2, if as a result of an incident, any pollution damage is caused in a Bunker Oil Convention place other than Hong Kong, no action may be brought in any court of Hong Kong to enforce a claim arising from the pollution damage.
Despite subsection (2), a claim arising from the pollution damage may be enforced in the Court if the incident also results in any pollution damage in Hong Kong.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Submission of Bunker Oil Convention States to jurisdiction of Court

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of any legal proceedings brought in the Court to enforce a claim under Part 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Bunker Oil Convention State is to be treated as having submitted to the jurisdiction of the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules of court may provide for the manner in which those proceedings are to be commenced and carried on.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is not to be construed as authorizing the issue of execution against the property of a state.
In this section, Bunker Oil Convention State (《燃油公約》國) means a state that is a party to the Bunker Oil Convention.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Time limit for legal proceedings etc.
section.leadIn: No legal proceedings to enforce a claim under Part 2 may be instituted unless the proceedings are commenced—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than 3 years after the claim arises; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the incident that causes the pollution damage; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the incident consists of a series of occurrences having the same origin, the first of those occurrences.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Enforcement of foreign judgments

subsection.content: The Foreign Judgments (Reciprocal Enforcement) Ordinance (Cap. 319), except sections 3, 5(2), 6(2) and (3), 9, 10, 11, 12 and 13, applies to a judgment given on or after the commencement* of Part 2 by a court of a Bunker Oil Convention place, other than a place in the People’s Republic of China, to enforce a claim in respect of a liability incurred under any law corresponding to section 5.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a reference to “a judgment to which the provisions of this Ordinance apply” in sections 4(1), 6(1) and 8 of the Foreign Judgments (Reciprocal Enforcement) Ordinance (Cap. 319) includes a judgment to which that subsection applies.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the judgment is final and conclusive between the parties to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the judgment orders the payment of a sum of money, other than a sum payable in respect of taxes or other charges of a like nature or in respect of a fine or other penalty.

subsection.content: A judgment is final and conclusive between the parties to it, despite the fact that an appeal is pending against it, or that it may still be subject to appeal, in any court of the place in which the court that gives the judgment is situated.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Limitation on amount of judgment (other than Hong Kong court judgment) enforceable in Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: If, on or after the commencement* of Part 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court of a place, other than a Bunker Oil Convention place, gives a judgment in respect of any liability in that place for any pollution damage in relation to which the Bunker Oil Convention applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the judgment may be recognized or enforced in Hong Kong under any law of Hong Kong relating to recognition and enforcement of judgments given in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: then despite the fact that that law may provide otherwise, the judgment may be recognized or enforced by a court of Hong Kong only up to the limit of liability prescribed in Part III of the Merchant Shipping (Limitation of Shipowners Liability) Ordinance (Cap. 434).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies only if the liability is incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shipowner of a ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person, other than the shipowner of a ship, who is entitled to limit their liability under Part III of the Merchant Shipping (Limitation of Shipowners Liability) Ordinance (Cap. 434).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Director may grant exemptions

subsection.content: The Director may, in a particular case, exempt in writing any person or ship from the application of any provision of section 13 or 14.
An exemption under this section may be granted subject to any condition that the Director may impose.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Notification of decisions of Director etc.

subsection.content: If the Director or an authorized person decides to refuse to issue an insurance certificate under section 16, the Director or the authorized person must, by notice in writing served on the applicant, inform the applicant of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

If the Director or an authorized person decides to cancel an insurance certificate under section 17, the Director or the authorized person must, by notice in writing served on the holder of the certificate, inform the holder of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

If the Director decides to refuse to grant an exemption under section 23, the Director must, by notice in writing served on the person by whom the exemption is sought, inform the person of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Power of Director to authorize certain persons as authorized persons

subsection.content: The Director may authorize any person, other than a public officer, as an authorized person.
An authorized person is not an agent or servant of the Government.
An authorized person may determine the fee to be paid on an application to the person for an insurance certificate to be issued by the person.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Power of Director to appoint persons to be enforcement officers
section.content: The Director may, for the purposes of sections 13 and 14, appoint any officer of the Marine Department to be an enforcement officer.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Powers of enforcement officers

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of ascertaining whether section 13 or 14 is complied with, an enforcement officer may exercise one or more of the following powers— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: board a ship;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: make or take any copy of any document produced to the officer under paragraph (b) or (c).

subsection.content: A person who wilfully obstructs an enforcement officer in the exercise of the officer’s power under subsection (1)(a) or (d) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who fails to comply with a request made by an enforcement officer under subsection (1)(c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Provision of false information etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed under section 15 or a request made under section 27—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any document or provides any information that the person knows to be false or misleading in a material respect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produces any document or provides any information that the person ought reasonably to have known to be false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(a) or (b) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Appeals

subsection.leadIn: A person who is aggrieved by any of the following decisions may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director or an authorized person to refuse to issue an insurance certificate under section 16;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director or an authorized person to impose any condition under section 16;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director or an authorized person to cancel an insurance certificate under section 17;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse to grant an exemption under section 23;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to impose any condition under section 23.

subsection.content: An appeal under subsection (1) does not suspend the decision appealed against.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Service of notice etc.
section.leadIn: A notice or other document (however described) required or permitted to be served or sent (however described) under this Ordinance is to be regarded as having been duly served or sent if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the Director and delivered to the Director’s principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the Director by registered post addressed to the Director at the Director’s principal office;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the individual and delivered to the individual by personal service; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the individual by registered post addressed to the individual at the individual’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a company as defined in section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the company and delivered to any officer of the company by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is left at, or sent by post to, the company’s registered office in Hong Kong; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a body corporate (other than a company described in paragraph (c))—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the body and delivered to any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the body; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the body by registered post addressed to the body at the body’s last known address; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the partnership and delivered to any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the partnership by registered post addressed to the partnership at the partnership’s last known address.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Saving for recourse actions
section.content: This Ordinance does not affect any claim, or the enforcement of any claim, that a person who incurs a liability under this Ordinance may have against another person in respect of the liability.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Offences by bodies corporate
section.leadIn: If a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a body corporate, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, or any person who was purporting to act in any of those capacities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was due to any neglect on the part of a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, or any person who was purporting to act in any of those capacities,

section.continued: the director, manager, secretary, officer or the person, as well as the body corporate, commits that offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Power to make regulations
section.content: The Financial Secretary may by regulations prescribe the fee to be paid on an application to the Director for an insurance certificate to be issued by the Director.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Delegation by Director

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Director may, either generally or in any particular case, delegate to any other public officer the performance or exercise on the Director’s behalf of any of the functions imposed or conferred on the Director under this Ordinance.

If any function imposed or conferred on the Director under this Ordinance is performed or exercised by any other public officer, the Director is, unless the contrary is proved, regarded as having delegated to the public officer under subsection (1) the performance or exercise of the function.
No delegation under subsection (1) is to be made of any power under this Ordinance to make subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: functions (職能) includes powers and duties.
